oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic or Conventional Palm Oil. Mainstream sustainability standards vs. organic standards
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Angulo, Jessenia
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Social aspects
Consumer issues
Environmental aspects
Knowledge management
Regulation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Consumers are requesting more information about the nutritious characteristics, social and, environmental responsibility around the products they are purchasing; but instead of facing an organic mainstream movement, new conventional standards are in the market. This document presents the main differences in the field implementation between the RSPO and the organic certification.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Angulo, Jessenia (2014) Organic or Conventional Palm Oil. Mainstream sustainability standards vs. organic standards. Paper at: IFOAM Organic World Congress 2014, Istanbul, Turkey, 13-15 October 2014. [Completed]
